cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the parametric knapsack problem, which is a well-known problem in computer science and optimization. The problem involves finding the optimal solution for a knapsack problem where the item profits are affine functions depending on a real-valued parameter. This problem is related to several subfields of computer science, including data structures (cs.DS), discrete mathematics (cs.DM), computational complexity (cs.CC), game theory (cs.GT), and information theory (cs.IT). The paper presents a fully polynomial-time approximation scheme (FPTAS) for the problem, which is a common technique used in approximation algorithms and falls under the scope of several of these subfields. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT, and cs.IT.
